verses.kjv: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
verses.ct: Then Eliphaz the Temanite responded:

verses.kjv: If we assay to commune with thee, wilt thou be grieved? but who can withhold himself from speaking?
verses.ct: "If someone tries to speak with you, will it upset you? But who could possibly keep silent right now?

verses.kjv: Behold, thou hast instructed many, and thou hast strengthened the weak hands.
verses.ct: Look, you have guided so many people, and you have given strength to those whose hands were weak.

verses.kjv: Thy words have upholden him that was falling, and thou hast strengthened the feeble knees.
verses.ct: Your words have lifted up those who were stumbling, and you have steadied those with shaking knees.

verses.kjv: But now it is come upon thee, and thou faintest; it toucheth thee, and thou art troubled.
verses.ct: But now that trouble has landed on you, you collapse; it strikes you, and you fall apart.

verses.kjv: Is not this thy fear, thy confidence, thy hope, and the uprightness of thy ways?
verses.ct: Isn't your deep reverence for God your source of confidence? Isn't the integrity of your life your reason for hope?

verses.kjv: Remember, I pray thee, who ever perished, being innocent? or where were the righteous cut off?
verses.ct: Think about it — when has an innocent person ever been destroyed? Where have upright people ever been wiped out?

verses.kjv: Even as I have seen, they that plow iniquity, and sow wickedness, reap the same.
verses.ct: From what I've observed, those who plant wrongdoing and cultivate evil end up harvesting exactly that.

verses.kjv: By the blast of God they perish, and by the breath of his nostrils are they consumed.
verses.ct: A single breath from God destroys them; a blast of his anger finishes them off.

verses.kjv: The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the fierce lion, and the teeth of the young lions, are broken.
verses.ct: The lion may roar and growl fiercely, but even the fangs of young lions get shattered.

verses.kjv: The old lion perisheth for lack of prey, and the stout lion’s whelps are scattered abroad.
verses.ct: The old lion starves when there is no prey, and the cubs of the mighty lion are scattered in every direction.

verses.kjv: Now a thing was secretly brought to me, and mine ear received a little thereof.
verses.ct: Now, a message came to me in secret — my ear caught just a whisper of it.

verses.kjv: In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falleth on men,
verses.ct: During unsettling thoughts from visions in the night, when heavy sleep falls over people,

verses.kjv: Fear came upon me, and trembling, which made all my bones to shake.
verses.ct: dread and trembling gripped me, making every bone in my body shake.

verses.kjv: Then a spirit passed before my face; the hair of my flesh stood up:
verses.ct: Then a spirit glided past me, and the hair on my skin stood on end.

verses.kjv: It stood still, but I could not discern the form thereof: an image was before mine eyes, there was silence, and I heard a voice, saying,
verses.ct: It stopped, but I couldn't make out its shape. A figure hovered in front of my eyes. There was silence, and then I heard a voice say,

verses.kjv: Shall mortal man be more just than God? shall a man be more pure than his maker?
verses.ct: 'Can a human being be more righteous than God? Can a person be more pure than the one who made him?

verses.kjv: Behold, he put no trust in his servants; and his angels he charged with folly:
verses.ct: Consider this — God doesn't even fully trust his servants, and he finds fault with his angels.

verses.kjv: How much less in them that dwell in houses of clay, whose foundation is in the dust, which are crushed before the moth?
verses.ct: How much less would he trust those who live in bodies of clay, built on a foundation of dust, crushed more easily than a moth?

verses.kjv: They are destroyed from morning to evening: they perish for ever without any regarding it.
verses.ct: Between dawn and dusk they are destroyed. They vanish forever, and no one even notices.

verses.kjv: Doth not their excellency which is in them go away? they die, even without wisdom.
verses.ct: Whatever greatness they had is stripped away. They die without ever gaining true wisdom."
